graph_title: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age
indicator_name: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: By 2030, provide legal identity for all, including birth registration
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age
methodology_global: This indicator provides the proportion of children under the age of five whose births are reported as being registered with the relevant national civil authorities. It is calculated by dividing the number of children under the age of five whose births are reported as being registered with the relevant national civil authorities by the total number of children under the age of five in the population multiplied by 100.
SDG_GOAL: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
SDG_TARGET: By 2030, provide legal identity for all, including birth registration
SDG_INDICATOR: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority, by age
source_organisation_1: Ministry of the Interior in Montenegro
